attributes.action: Give all students their CAGs across the UK, following the Scottish government.
attributes.additional_details: Following the Scottish government's decision that all 125,000 downgraded grades will be reversed, students will be issued their CAG (teacher predicted grades) and this will lead to an estimated 20% jump in the pass rate and a record level of attainment overall. This will put Scottish students at an extreme advantage over other students within the UK as OFQUAL are following the same system as the SQA, UK students can expect the same harsh downgrades with up to 39% of grades set to be adjusted down, and thus for it to be as fair as possible the UK government must follow the Scottish government and award CAGs.
attributes.background: Give all A-Level students their CAGs as Scotland have done so, as a failure to do this will put Scottish students at a significant benefit to other students within the UK who will have had their CAGs downgraded. With an estimated 39% of CAGs going to be downgraded the UK government must act.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Review the standardisation of grades so state school pupils aren't disadvantaged: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325422

Remove Ofqual's moderation of 2020 results based on schools previous performance: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328957

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
